intro.description: This kind of analysis examines the content of a set of columns.

item.title: Set the analysis metadata.
item.description: To open the Create New Analysis wizard, right click Analyses on the DQ Repository view and select New Analysis. Then select analysis under Column Analysis folder. Alternatively, browse to and click right on a column on the DQ Repository view tree and select Analyze. The wizard prompts you to provide the analysis metadata (name, purpose, description...). Upon completion, an editor opens in which you can modify the analysis metadata and define the analysis settings.

item.title: Select the columns to analyze.
item.description:
In the editor, click Select Columns button(or New Connection first) under the Data Preview section to open a dialog box in which you can browse to and select data to analyze. Alternatively, you can drop the columns from the DQ Repository tree view onto the Analyzed Columns box in the editor.
Under Datamining Type, define the type of the corresponding column.
Note: Nominal means that the column contains textual values (no order or mathematical function applicable). Interval means that mathematical functions (such as the average) can be used.

item.title: Select the indicators to compute.
item.description: Click the Select Indicators button under the Data Preview section to open the Indicator Selection dialog box. Apply the indicators required for each column by selecting the corresponding check boxes(or click the link below).

item.title: Add a UDI
item.description: Click the UDI button for each column you want to set the User Defined Indicator for. In the UDI Selection dialog box, select the check boxes which correspond to the indicators desired.

item.title: Set the indicator options.
item.description: Click on the Options icon next to each indicator you want to define the values for (or click the link below). By default, reasonable options are chosen.

item.title: Choose a pattern for each column
item.description: For each column, you can add a pattern indicator. There are two kinds of patterns. Regular patterns are regular expressions (not supported by all databases) and SQL patterns are the patterns that you add in a "LIKE" clause. Click the add pattern button next to each column, then browse to and select the pattern you want to add in the dialog box which appears. Alternatively, drop a pattern from the DQ Repository tree view onto a column.

item.title: Set filters on the data to be analyzed.
item.description: This is an optional step. By default, all of the data is analyzed. To filter the data, write an SQL "WHERE" clause in the Data Filter text box.

item.title: Analyze.
item.description: Click the Run icon, located towards the top left of the editor, to execute the analysis. Alternatively, right click the analysis on the DQ Repository tree view and click the Run icon on the list which appears.
